result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Plea hearing on November 11, 2022 at 03:15 pm.

Defendant Toni Ann Feather-Silas in court, in custody.  Attorney Sara Elizabeth Stertz in court for Toni Ann Feather-Silas.  Prosecuting attorney Kari Hoffman in court for the State of Wisconsin. 22CF350 - bond modification requested by defense, state opposes, court denies.  Present bond continued
Plea hearing scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
Status conference on November 1, 2022 at 11:15 am.

Defendant Toni Ann Feather-Silas appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Sara Elizabeth Stertz appeared by video for Toni Ann Feather-Silas.  Prosecuting attorney Kimberly A Hardtke in court for the State of Wisconsin. Def waives in person appearance.  Reading of the information waived in all files and NG pleas entered to all counts in all files. Present bond continued
Status conference scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 11:15 am.

Defendant Toni Ann Feather-Silas in court, in custody at the Brown County Jail.  Attorney Sara Elizabeth Stertz in court for Toni Ann Feather-Silas.  Prosecuting attorney Kari Hoffman in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant/attorney waives right to Preliminary Hearing and files waiver form with Court.
Offer - 9/26/22
Court accepts waiver and orders defendant bound over to assigned branch.
Information to be filed.
Bond continued.
Arraignment scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 11:30 am.
